INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth’s background
4

or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Last week, staff member spoke to youth in a derogatory manner. On
another occasion, a staff member was verbally abusive to youth by
swearing at youth and threatening to hit youth.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on 12/01/2022.
I interviewed the Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist, who was also the
complainant, via phone on 12/02/2022. Youth A was placed at the
facility on 10/19/2022 and has been struggling because she does not
like her placement. Youth A has been having behavioral issues and she
has been notified and provided with incident reports. Youth A reported
that staff swear and threatened her, but she did not provide the names
of the staff. She reports Youth A made the same allegations against
two previous licensed foster homes that were investigated and there
were no findings. She expressed no concerns with Youth A’s care or
safety.
I interviewed the Director at the facility on 12/02/2022. The Director
reported Youth A has been struggling due to her behavior. There are
several incident reports involving Youth A, and she is the one that is
swearing and is physically aggressive with staff and other youths when
she does not get her way. Youth A instigates fights and has physically
lashed out at the other youths at the facility. She was suspended off the
school bus this week for cussing on the bus. The incident reports were
reviewed and discussed.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 12/02/2022. Youth A is 12 years
old and has been at the facility for two months. Youth A reported she is
receiving therapy, gets her medication daily, and likes the food. When
asked about the allegations Youth A got up and walked out of the room.
I followed Youth A to the hallway where she was standing with the
Director. Youth A requested that the Director sit with her for the rest of
the interview. Youth A said that Staff 1 told her to, “shut the fuck up.”
She said Staff 2 was present and did not do anything. She reported that
last month Youth B pushed her and staff were present and did not
intervene.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 12/02/2022. Youth B has been
at the facility for 5 months. She admitted there was an incident involving
her and Youth A last week. Youth B said she moved Youth A’s stuff off
the table, because Youth A was told by staff to move them, but Youth A
refused to listen to staff. Youth A hit Youth B on the arm, and so Youth
4

B pushed Youth A. Youth B said staff immediately intervened and
separated them. She denied witnessing Staff 1 or any other staff swear
or threatened Youth A. Youth B reported that Youth A is the one that
cusses and threatens staff. She said Youth A uses the “N” word with
staff and staff redirect her and tell her not to use that word. Youth B
expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility. She said all the
staff are very professional and she likes how structured the facility
operates.
I interviewed Staff 1, at the facility on 12/02/2022. Staff 1 reported that
she has been working at the facility for one year but has over 10 years
of working in residentials. She has completed all her training including
CPI. Staff 1 said she has a good relationship with all the youths but
noted that Youth A gets mad when Staff 1 tries to redirect her or hold
her accountable for her behavior. She denied swearing or threatening
Youth A. She reported Youth A is the one that swears at Staff and uses
the “N” word. She was asked about an incident involving Youth A being
pushed by Youth B, and she denied being present during that incident.
I interviewed Staff 2, at the facility on 12/02/2022. Staff 2 has been
working at the facility for 8 years. She reported Youth A struggles with
listening and following rules. She said Youth A is easily triggered when
redirected. Staff 2 denied witnessing any staff member swearing or
threatening Youth A. She reported Youth A is the one that swears and
threatens staff and other Youths. Staff 2 said Youth A uses the “N”
word and racial slurs with staff and the other youths and that staff are
addressing this with Youth A in group therapy. Staff 2 said she was
present during the incident involving Youth A and B and that she and
the other staff member immediately separated the two youths and
wrote an incident report. She said last week Youth A was yelling and
stomping her feet and when she tried to redirect her, Youth A started to
scream “this is abuse.” Staff 2 reported that she and other staff try to
deescalate the situations with Youth A by talking to her and removing
the other youths from the room and that she usually helps her calm
down.
I spoke with Youth A’s Therapist via telephone on 12/12/2022.
Therapist reported she meets weekly with Youth A for individual
sessions and Youth A has not reported any concerns regarding staff or
the facility.
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation:
• Incident Report,11/27/2022, authored by Staff 2. Report was
consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Incident Report, 11/29/2022, authored by staff 2. Reports Youth A
cussing and using racial slurs with Staff 2.
4

• Incident Report, 12/01/2022, Youth A was suspended from the school
bus 12/1/22 to 12/06/22 due to swearing and being loud with the other
kids on the bus.
• Staff 1’s employee file, No disciplinary action reports.
• Reviewed facility’s Behavior Management Policies and Practices:
Resident Behavior Management and consequences are based on the
basic understanding of your Treatment Plan goals and objectives.
While a wide variety of consequences may be used, these are never to
be excessively punitive or self-defeating. It is clearly understood that
corporal punishment, in any form (i.e. spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, holding or pulling hair, etc.) is not to be used by
any staff member. Likewise, verbal abuse (i.e. swearing, cursing,
profanities, obscene gestures, ridiculing, sarcasm or unflattering
nicknames, etc.) are not to be used by any staff member. Excessive
chemical, mechanical or physical restraints are prohibited. Staff
members are not permitted to deny you any essential program
services.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is no supporting evidence
that these allegations occurred. Youth A provided changing accounts
that were not supported by the identified staff and other youth, who
reported that Youth A is the one that is using derogatory language with
staff and other youths.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
